line_1: And may sweet Shirley still inherit,
And not like young rakes who 're in haste to inherit,)
line_2: Says Tom, (who's a lad of a generous spirit,

line_1: Mean thought! he deems it nobler to inherit:
line_2: Does all this pomp and state proceed from merit?

line_1: Then how shall I who still inherit,
line_2: A Tincture of the Lawyer's Spirit;

line_1: Wakes thee now? tho' he inherit
line_2: Oh! Lyre divine, what daring Spirit

line_1: Wakes thee now? Though he inherit
line_2: Oh! lyre divine, what daring spirit
And double portion of his Spirit;
Who only show regard to merit,

line_1: The Prophet's Throne in peaceful sway inherit,
line_2: Tho Con— may in time, when he has merit,

line_1: With all which men think they inherit,
line_2: That soul and body, matter and spirit,
